content.description: Good steep climbing that starts in a small right-facing corner. Goes left of the bolt line in the middle before going back right.
content.protection: 6 bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The next route right of Rolling Thunder. Starts about 10 to 20 feet right and uphill of Rolling Thunder.

content.description: Good, sustained and steep climbing all the way to the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts and can be supplemented with small gear. Two bolt anchor shared with San Francisco Peeks.
content.location: The start is 10 feet to the right and uphill of San Francisco Peeks.

content.description: Steep climbing at the start leads to low angled but runout terrain at the top. Angles up and right on the slab to the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts although the guidebook says 5. You may be able to supplement the bolts with some small gear. Two bolt anchor at top shared with Rolling Thunder.
content.location: The leftmost route on the Left Formation.

content.description: Start by scampering up into the groove on some interesting holds. Once you enter the runnel the real fun begins. Stem, chimney and finally crimp your way onto the face and to larger holds below the chains.
content.location: Shares chains with a 5.11 to the right. Look for bolts leading directly up a runnel groove on the right side of the formation. Bolts lead right out onto the face and then directly up to the finish.
